99f0d89b9cee2659,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=99f0d89b9cee2659","http://www.indeed.com/job/center-director-pa-nj-child-care-centers-99f0d89b9cee2659","Center Director, PA & NJ Child Care Centers","Lightbridge Academy","Iselin, NJ, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",55000.0,65000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","It starts with you! As a leader and Center Director, you play a key role in the lives of staff, parents and children by inspiring your team to achieve excellence, forming meaningful relationships, advocating for the education and wellbeing of children and leading a high quality child care center. If you possess a passion for early childhood education, a strong aptitude for business and a love for developing and growing a team…join us!
**Your Mission:**

The pulse of every Lightbridge Academy stems from the leadership that is demonstrated by each member of the center administration team. As the Center Director, you embody the Lightbridge Academy Core Values and foster a nurturing, happy and fun learning environment for all those in your Circle of Care. You are responsible for all operational aspects of the business while also demonstrating the ability to achieve center enrollment goals by providing a WOW experience. The ideal team member will continually strive for excellence, be a strong communicator, and a fast learner.
**Job Responsibilities**
* Create strong relationships resulting in high rate of retention and referrals by creating a WOW customer experience to all those in our Circle of Care.
* Build community relationships and enrollment through participation in local area marketing and execution of open houses and other marketing.
* Achieve center occupancy goals by providing center tours and following the Lightbridge enrollment process.
* Build a nurturing and positive learning environment by encouraging the growth and development of all those in the Circle of Care.
* Ensure proper implementation of the Lightbridge Academy program and Seedlings curriculum.
* Uphold discretion in dealing with all confidential matters and information.
* Inspire and engage team members by example and providing mentoring and coaching.
* Ensure the health, safety and wellbeing of children and staff members.
* Adhere to all Lightbridge Academy policies, procedures and state licensing regulations.
* Conduct regularly scheduled staff meetings and trainings.
* Oversee the hiring process.
* Ensures accurate financial and key performance indicators.
* Complete a minimum of 20 hours of ongoing professional development.
**Requirements:**
* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree preferably in Education
* Two years of experience as a Center Director
* Two years of management experience
* Strong time management, leadership and organizational skills
* Flexible and able to multi-task
* Strong Microsoft Office skills
* Financial and business acumen
* Completion of CPR and First Aid certification
**Benefits:**
As a cherished member of the Lightbridge family, we offer benefits that range from financial to well-being and beyond!
* Competitive salary
* Childcare discount
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Opportunity for advancement

column1: 1ccfc70c69e8b76e,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=1ccfc70c69e8b76e","http://www.indeed.com/job/assistant-buyer-1ccfc70c69e8b76e","Assistant Buyer","Esdegco","Cranbury, NJ, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","hourly",20.0,24.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**Overview**

A world-class company is looking for an Assistant Buyer and Sales Support Specialist. This is a dynamic role that combines purchasing and sales support functions. This position is responsible for assisting the buying team in product selection, vendor management, and inventory control while also providing essential support to the sales team. This role is on-site.
**Responsibilities**
**Purchasing and Inventory Management:**
* Assist buyers in product selection, sourcing, and vendor negotiations.
* Conduct market research to identify trends and potential product opportunities.
* Maintain accurate product information and pricing data.
* Monitor inventory levels and assist with replenishment planning.
* Coordinate with vendors to ensure timely delivery and resolve any issues**.**
**Sales Support:**
* Provide administrative support to the sales team, including order processing, data entry, and customer inquiries.
* Prepare sales reports and analysis as needed.
* Assist with sales presentations and customer demonstrations.
* Coordinate with the warehouse and shipping departments to ensure timely order fulfillment.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external customers.
**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain management, or related field preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $20.00 - $24.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Benefits:
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
Schedule:
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

2f70e6b1182eab5e,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=2f70e6b1182eab5e","http://www.indeed.com/job/afterschool-aba-behavior-technician-dsp-warren-n-2f70e6b1182eab5e","Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician / DSP Warren (N)","Sunshine Advantage","Newton, NJ, US","parttime, fulltime, contract, internship","2024-08-19","direct_data","hourly",20.0,25.0,"USD",True,"","","","","","Sunshine Advantage is hiring in various locations in Warren County. Apply today and ask our hiring managers about open positions in your area.
**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.
**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**
Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location
Online and on the job training
Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career
to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA
Referral Bonus
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.
Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.
Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.
Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.
Collect accurate data daily.
Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.
Attends staff meetings and training as requested.
Completes additional job duties as assigned.
**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**
High School Diploma, GED
Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism
Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.
Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.
Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization
Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years
Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.
Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.
Background Clearance is mandatory.
Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

778d6032d3b289b1,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=778d6032d3b289b1","http://www.indeed.com/job/residential-counselor-ii-778d6032d3b289b1","Residential Counselor II","RiseWell Community Services","Queens Village, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","","hourly","","","USD",False,"","","","","","**RiseWell Community Services is seeking a Full Time Residential Counselor to join our Residential Department , and provide services to people with psychiatric disabilities in a transitional licensed residential program.**
**Reports To:** Program Supervisor
**Department** Residential Services
**Schedule:** Sun & Mon 8am-4pm and Tues, Wed, Thur 2pm-10pm
**Qualifications:**

High school diploma with two years’ experience working with persons with psychiatric disabilities OR a BA in Human Services. Clean valid NY State Driver’s License. Fingerprinting, criminal record check, approval from NYS Office of Mental Health.
**Job Function:**
Provide supportive counseling, restorative services, and crisis intervention to people with psychiatric disabilities in a transitional licensed residential program.
**ENEFITS INCLUDE:**
* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* Retirement 401K Savings Plan with Employer Match
* Generous Paid Time Off for Full-time and Eligible Part-Time Employees
* 13 paid Holidays for Full-time and Eligible Part-Time Employees
* Long and Short Term Disability
* Life Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* CALM App Subscription
* Flexible Work Schedules
* Career Growth & Promotional Opportunities
* Comprehensive Paid Training
* Supplemental Accident, Illness and Hospitalization Insurance
* Supplemental Pet Insurance
* Encouragement for Educational Professional Advancement
* Employee Perks & Discounts on Broadway shows, theme parks, and other attractions
* Eligibility for Federal/Public Loan Forgiveness
**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:**

RiseWell provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
**About Us:**

RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is a multi-service, community-based social wellness agency and is a major provider of health and wellness, senior & children’s services, housing, and support services in Suffolk, Nassau, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan. Originally comprised of an alliance of family advocacy groups, RiseWell Community Services was incorporated as a not-for-profit in 1972. For fifty years, RiseWell has developed innovative, successful programs that are designed to meet the needs of vulnerable populations, such as individuals in recovery, those living with chronic medical conditions, adult home residents, the homeless, low-income seniors and at-risk children. Since 1977, RiseWell’s mission has been to engage people with disabilities in community service and provide a wide range of programs including care coordination, housing, clinical treatment, employment, peer advocacy, and other rehabilitative services. One of RiseWell’s main goals is to improve the lives of people with disabilities and their families through education, information and referral services, legislative action and program development.

**Fastest growing lawn care company in the area looking to grow our team!**

**Typical Day:**
* Start the day loading up the truck we supply.
* Drive a route of approx. 15-20 locations to deliver and perform Aeration services.
* Manage your own schedule and route for efficient service delivery.

* Providing Invoices for the customer at the completion of job.

Once hired, you will start off by assisting one of our current drivers with services as part of your training, & learning more about the business model. Training, vehicle, and company iPad provided.
**Quality service, personal growth, and skills for empowerment are how we operate.**
**More than a job, WE CREATE CAREERS with a wage you can do more than just survive on.**

Email us a resume today for immediate consideration.

f11c1490ca37cb83,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f11c1490ca37cb83","http://www.indeed.com/job/busserporter-f11c1490ca37cb83","Busser/Porter","Olly Olly Market","New York, NY, US","parttime, fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","hourly",20.0,25.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**Job description**

We don't call it a busser, a greeter, a runner, or a porter because the Backbone is a little bit of everything for everyone. The Backbone provides overall support and structure of all of the moving parts of Olly Olly Market. Located in the historic Starrett Lehigh Building and made up of 9 fast-casual concepts from New York-based chefs and 2 beautiful bars! Teamwork and community are the names of the game at Olly Olly Market, where the Backbone interacts daily with fellow team members and guests, keeping the common areas clean and in working order. We are looking to add more key members to our team of individuals who help keep Olly Olly Market in top condition as the best dining destination in Chelsea! Olly Olly Market is open Monday through Friday from 8am-8pm, Saturday Noon-8pm.
Due to the flexible nature of this position, we welcome those seeking part-time and full-time positions.
Looking to fill a handful of part-time hours in your schedule? This is the job for you!
Looking for full-time employment, but tired of working long hours on the weekend? Come on down and apply!
**Summary of Essential Job Functions:**
* Clear tables of trays, food waste, disposable and recyclable materials. Wipe down tables and reset furniture.
* Continuously circulate dirty and clean dishes and service items.
* Remove and replenish garbage and recycling receptacles.
* Clean all surfaces utilizing different methods, performing tasks daily, weekly, and monthly as needed.
* Be the first point of contact for positive guest interaction, providing knowledge, and answering a multitude of questions.
* Bend, reach, lift, carry, stand, walk and stoop as needed to perform all support tasks.
* Provide support to all vendors, keeping clean the shared spaces and equipment.
* Perform all other support tasks as needed, under the direction of OOM Management.
* Operate within and maintain a pleasant and supportive work environment, interacting with all employees in a multi-faceted and collaborative work environment.
If you're looking for a professional yet casual work environment where service is everyone's common goal, then Olly Olly Market could be the place for you!

Expected hours: 10 – 35 per week

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance
Shift:
* Day shift
* Night shift

299a1d14ade6a370,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=299a1d14ade6a370","https://fa-errt-saasfaprod1.fa.ocs.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_xx/requisitions/preview/3169","Underwriting Assistant - Construction","SCOR","New York, NY, US","","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",87000.0,101000.0,"USD",False,"","","Insurance","","","This is a great opportunity to join SCOR, a company that values excellence, innovation, and teamwork. You will work in a dynamic and supportive environment, where you will receive training, feedback, and recognition. You will also have the chance to work on challenging and diverse projects, and contribute to the success of our business

We are looking for an Underwriting Assistant to support our Construction department. You will work with two underwriters and help them with their daily tasks, in coordination with data capture teams, technical accounting, and operations. You will also assist them in managing their book of business and improving the underwriting process.
* Candidate will be allocated to 2 underwriters in the Construction department.
* Provide reliable, accurate and efficient support to the Underwriting team in core day to day underwriting tasks.
* Partner with SCOR's corporate resources (Data Capture Services, Technical Accounting and Operations) in support of underwriting teams.
* Help the underwriting team manage their book of business, ensuring completion of tasks in a timely and error-free manner.
* Assist underwriters with triaging and initial underwriting analysis of new projects and extensions

* Find/propose ways to improve/adapt the underwriting process through simplification and/or automation using excel and other tools. Liaise with the Chief Technical Officer and underwriting teams to implement changes.
* 2 to 5 years related experience in risk, finance or insurance is a plus but not mandatory.
* Willingness to learn and develop strong technical skills in Construction Insurance.
* Strong analytical abilities and attention to detail.

As an international company, our common culture is defined by “The SCOR Way.” Serving both to build momentum that drives the Group forward and as a compass to guide our actions and choices, The SCOR Way is anchored by five core values, reflecting the input of employees at all levels of the Group. You will support the Director in overseeing various aspects of the Certificate of Occupancy process, including filing applications, scheduling inspections, and vendor coordination. This role offers a great opportunity for growth and development in project management within a dynamic team environment. **Key Responsibilities:*** **Project Coordination:** Help manage day-to-day project operations, including tracking progress and supporting scheduling.

* **Communication Support:** Relay relevant project information to team members and superiors effectively. This includes but no limited to building management, architects, engineers, and contractors. Collaborate with building management team to gather necessary information to resolve violations.

* **Document Management:** Aid in maintaining accurate project documentation, building violations, construction plans, and correspondence.
* **Permit/Violation Management:** Support the management of permits and compliance with relevant governmental requirements.
* **Meeting Coordination:** Book and prepare meeting rooms, set up conference calls, and take notes and assist with regular project status meetings.
* **Status Reporting:** Support in preparing monthly project status reports, including Violation reports, Open permit applications and Final Certificate of Occupancy reports.
* **Hearing Attendance:** Attend Environment Control Board Hearings as required.
* **Training:** Participate in training sessions and workshops on building code and compliance procedures to stay up to date with the lates building codes.
**Benefits:*** **Health Care:** Multiple medical, dental, and vision plans; Employee Assistance Program
* **Financial:** Competitive salary; matching 401(k); FSAs and HSA; employer-paid life and AD&D insurance; paid leave & disability programs
* **Social Wellness:** 19+ days of PTO; mental health resources; fertility, surrogacy, and adoption assistance; volunteer days
* **Career Development:** Learning programs; tuition & certification reimbursement; internal advancement opportunities
**Working Conditions:*** **Location:** New York
* **Travel:** Some travel may be required throughout New York City
**Compensation:**
* With an annual bonus that is tied to performance
Qualifications:
**Qualifications:*** **Experience:** 0-2 years of experience in project management, preferably with a focus on interior renovations.
* **Skills:** Strong communication skills, both written and verbal; ability to work effectively in a team setting and work independently
* **Education:** Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Civil or MEP Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or a related field preferred.
* **Attributes:** Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong time management skills and able to adapt in a fast-paced environment.
* **Additional Skills:** Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office Applications.
* **Preferred Skills** : SiteCompli, DOB BIS, DOB Now Build
Join us at Related Management Company and take the first step in your project management career with opportunities for growth and development in an engaging work environment.

Related Companies is a global real estate and lifestyle company defined by innovation and the most prominent privately-owned real estate firm in the United States with over sixty billion in assets owned or under development including the 28-acre Hudson Yards neighborhood on Manhattan’s West Side, The Grand and Related Santa Clara in California and The 78 in Chicago. The Educational Assistant shall meet the requirements for assistant teacher and/or caregiver, set by the regulatory agencies, Health Department and Bureau of Day Care and the sponsoring Board of the Childcare Center, by which she/he is employed.

educational director.

creation of teaching aids and help maintain school items and property.

d4247b758c2d16f9,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d4247b758c2d16f9","http://www.indeed.com/job/physics-teacher-nys-certified-d4247b758c2d16f9","Physics Teacher (NYS Certified)","Williamsburg Charter High School","Brooklyn, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",59535.0,81380.0,"USD",False,"","","Education And Schools","","","**WILLIAMSBURG CHARTER HIGH SCHOOL - Science Teacher** **Program**

WCHS’s powerful educational program enables every student to graduate well-prepared for college and the world beyond it. Most importantly, all WCHS students mature intellectually, socially, and morally as a result of being an active member of a school community that endorses high expectations that challenge each student to achieve his/her full potential.

In order to fulfill its mission, WCHS is looking for exceptional teachers. Our teachers play very critical roles in realizing the core mission, philosophy, and unique youth-centered approach to the school’s educational design. WCHS teachers are not just classroom teachers, but school teachers—educators that are committed to facilitating the entire learning and instructional process and coaching young people to become independent learners, thinkers, and researchers.
**Prospective Williamsburg Charter High School Teachers:**
* Are committed to the idea that every child can succeed at high levels
* Believe that they have been called to teach and empower young people
* Demonstrate a commitment to providing students with a rigorous academic experience
* Are resilient, resourceful, relentless, and well-able to adapt to the many changes that can happen in an organization focused solely on doing what is best for students
* Excel at working in a highly collaborative, professional setting but can also work independently
* Understand the unique needs of the community they serve as well as the complex issues that affect urban youth and their families
* Are committed to inquiry-based teaching
* Engage a youth development approach in their interactions with young people by being sensitive to their developmental needs
* Are passionate and positive about school culture
* Feel full responsibility for students’ achievement
* Love ‘the details’ and realize that student success depends almost exclusively on them
* Are reflective and willing to improve upon their practice through professional development and support
* Effectively manage their time, resources, and technology
* Are convinced of the transformative power of education for all students, families, and educators
**Position Description**
The ideal Williamsburg Charter High School teacher will provide our students with rigorous instruction. They will be responsible for the following:
Teacher as Advisor

As students transition to high school, one of the things they could lose is the comfort of having a teacher who understands their background, challenges, and successes. Research has shown that this relationship is a key part of having students feel accounted for and by extension, accountable. In support of our students, our teachers are also Advisors to between 12-15 students for the duration of their high school career. This allows the teacher to become a part of the developmental process of their students and allows each family to have a primary contact within the school at all times. Advisors serve students and families by:
* Taking complete ownership of the academic, behavioral, and overall success of a group of 12-15 students
* Ensuring advisees are in attendance, punctual, excelling in all their classes, and seeking out appropriate support
* Creating an advisory period that acts as ‘home base’ for each student
* Being the academic expert on each advisee
* Acting as the liaise between the student, the family, and the school teams
* Teaching the advisory curriculum that has been created for their advisees’ grade
* Accompanying advisees on educational field trips as determined by the School Leader
* Contacting their advisee’s families a minimum of seven times a year and responding within 24 hours to all communications from their advisee’s families
* Developing and overseeing Individual Student Support Plan plans twice a year for each of their advisees
* Facilitating discipline-related required meetings on behalf of their advisees
* Performing any other advisor-related duties as requested
Ensuring Student Learning Through Data-driven Instruction:
* Prepare rigorous, student-centered lesson plans that will engage and motivate students to learn
* Plan standards-based units of study with clear, intended outcomes and goals in mind
* Provide meaningful feedback on student work to determine student progress and to make suggestions for improvement
* Proactively and relentlessly seek new ways to promote student learning
* Create thoughtful, standards-based assessments

* Work closely with school leaders and colleagues, using data to drive instruction and by extension, consistently raising student achievement and intervening with improvement plans and support for struggling students
* Have fun and pass the love of learning onto students!
* Design opportunities for students to use the world around them as a classroom through field trips and or/inviting guests into the classroom as appropriate
* Hold students to high behavioral and academic expectations and support students to succeed
* Model professional and collegial behavior for students
* Engage in the process of collaborative evaluation with school leaders
* Ensure that students are well-prepared for all New York State exams and WCHS interim assessments
Personal Commitment to On-Going Learning
* Participate in all assemblies, meetings, school-sponsored events, and professional development activities offered during or after work hours
* Participate in focus groups, evaluations, and committees as requested to assist with the constant improvement of the school as a whole

* Participate and support WCHS open-door classroom policy, allowing parents and teachers and other stakeholders to informally observe your work and actively seeking to observe the work of your colleagues for professional development
Positively Contributing to Student and Teacher Culture

* Arrive at school no later than 7:55 AM (to ensure that the classroom is clean, supplies are prepared and the instructor is ready to receive students) and leave no earlier than 3:10 PM (to hold necessary interventions, hold office hours, attend school meetings, and to ensure that students that need extra help are able to receive it). Even with these times parameters in mind, we ultimately seek educators that will simply do whatever it takes and will work relentlessly to ensure each student’s learning is maximized
* Teach four class periods per school day
* Serve two periods of School Service per week as determined by his/her supervisor (e.g., Study Hall supervision, cafeteria duty, hallway duty, monitoring of student entry and exit, etc.)
* Cover at least five periods per semester for absent teachers

* Proactively involve the student’s family in their learning through regular communications including (but not limited to): weekly informal communication via emails, notes, telephone calls, and meetings

* Realize that although student achievement is central to our work, Williamsburg Charter High School graduates are not just academically well-prepared, but also good citizens of their community. The cornerstone of our ideology is based on providing students with life skills and a sense of responsibility to their community in addition to an excellent education
* Share expertise and curriculum with colleagues

* Respond to all school-related communications within 24 hours, including but not limited to voicemails and emails, from Williamsburg Charter High School faculty and staff (including supervisors and other teachers)

* Attend and participate in school-related activities and events outside of normal school hours (e.g., Parent Advisory meetings, Back-to-School Night, field trips, student events, and performances, etc.)
* Adhere to the WCHS Student Handbook, Teacher Handbook, Personnel Policies, and Instructional Manual
Education and Credentials
* Bachelor’s degree
* At least two years of experience teaching in an urban high school setting
* New York State certified 7-12
* New York State Fingerprint clearance
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
Physical Setting:
* Charter school
* School
Schedule:
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
Application Question(s):
* Do you have a valid NYS Teaching Certificate?
Ability to Relocate:
* Brooklyn, NY 11206: Relocate before starting work (Required)
Work Location: In person","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Williamsburg-Charter-High-School","https://www.thewcs.org","Brooklyn, NY","51 to 200","$1M to $5M (USD)","","","","",""

**\\*CLOSED SUNDAYS\\***
**\\*Opportunity for Growth and Promotion\\***

As a **Business Development Call Center Agent** your role is vital in managing our digital business prospects. **\\*This is** **not** **a remote position.** You will contribute to a next generation car buying experience by developing a real connection with our prospective customers primarily via today's preferred communication channels. You will be tasked with managing a high-volume number of inbound/outbound calls and emails in a timely manner. Identify customer needs, schedule in-person and virtual sales appointment, partner with the sales consultants, and provide pricing and vehicle availability information.
* Respond to all customer internet inquires via email, SMS and phone under 1hr and with content that meets the company’s mystery shop guidelines.
* Serve as the first-level expert on our products and services, the purchase process, and the DARCARS brand.
* Convert inquiries to dealership visit or virtual appointments.
* Adhere to phone communication scripts and email templates.
* Document all customer contact activity in eLeads (crm)
* Meet, or exceed, individual performance objectives: response time, response rate, appointment set rate, workbook follow up activities and close rate conversions etc.
* Follow best practice guides for short term and long term follow up with customers.
**Requirements & Qualifications:**
* Computer savvy with a full working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* Quick learner, able to absorb substantive product and service information
* Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills
* Commitment to quality, process improvement, innovation, and excellence
* Professional appearance and work ethics
* High volume outgoing calls, ranging from 70+ calls per day
* Advanced computer & phone skills
* Minimum typing 35-40 words per minute at minimum
* Experience using customer tracking systems to track calls and appointments preferred
* Prior retail, sales, service BDC, receptionist, call center, or sales BDC experience preferred
* Appointment setting experience a plus
* Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Various language proficiency is always a plus
* Team player, strong organizational and time management skills
* Availability to work evenings and weekends if necessary
* High School or equivalent
* Must be at least eighteen years of age
* Must be able to pass pre-employment screen (background)
**Benefits**
* Insurance: medical, vision, dental
* Short-term and long-term disability plans
* Life Insurance
* Employee discounts on vehicle purchases, parts and service repairs
* Opportunities to join our community service initiatives

*This job advertisement in no way states or implies that these are the only duties and responsibilities to be performed by this employee. This advertisement is merely a preview of the role in solicitation. The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties and responsibilities upon the request of a supervisor.*

532c5281f1605720,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=532c5281f1605720","https://bookofthemonth.applytojob.com/apply/VSGsSf2nMa/Editorial-Assistant-Rotational-Program?source=INDE&~","Editorial Assistant Rotational Program","Book of the Month","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",62400.0,70000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**Summary:**

The Editorial Rotational Program mission is to accelerate the professional growth and development of Early Career Editorial professionals through exposure to a multitude of assignments, apprenticeship style learning, and accelerated responsibility. We are looking for driven, tenacious, and pragmatic team members who have the desire and potential to rise over time into a significant contributor within the Editorial team and our broader direct-to-consumer lifestyle business.

As a full time Editorial Assistant, this program will offer employees the opportunity to explore areas such as: Analytics & Reporting, Industry Relations, Operations, Licensing & Contracts, Cross-Functional Business Initiatives, and Book Selections. After approximately 2 years, team members will be placed in a more specialized role based on performance, strengths, and interests demonstrated over the previous years.
**Success in this program will be achieved by approaching work with the following characteristics:**
* Making High Quality Work: Learning how to organize, prioritize, and check work for efficiency, accuracy, and proper formatting
* Getting Things Done: Exhibits sense of urgency & follow through in assigned tasks; proactively communicates status updates of tasks
* Possessing Good Judgment: Demonstrates upward trajectory in thinking through steps of work thoroughly and logically.
* Being A Good Learner: Receives feedback well and incorporates it to improve
**What You’ll Do…**

* Administrative: Perform administrative tasks such as building and maintaining various trackers and reports, and preparing/proofreading a variety of documents, including agendas, memos, contact directories, presentations, and documents for special projects
* Analytics & Reporting: Organize and analyze data to find trends; input findings into spreadsheets and charts for stakeholder review
* Industry Relations: Assist with maintaining & expanding contact databases, developing presentations for publishers, and communicating efficiently and professionally with industry partners
* Turnover Operations: Coordinate and input Editorial content into internal company systems as part of the monthly book turnover process
* Licensing & Contracts: Draft and execute licensing agreements, manage trackers, and update in a timely and accurate manner

* Cross-Functional Initiatives: Support the coordination and execution of cross-functional business initiatives, including but not limited to: audio production & acquisition, sourcing foreign titles, literary magazine, etc.
* Book Selections: Read and evaluate manuscripts, providing feedback on their potential for BOTM
**What You Should Have…**
* Strong work ethic; ability to learn quickly, take on new challenges, and apply feedback
* A desire to learn quickly and grow over time
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Strong prioritization skills that allow you to keep projects on track
* Ability to do math and conduct data analysis
* Strong writing and proofreading skills, as well as excellent attention to detail
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interface comfortably with people at all levels
* Great judgment, with the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and care
* Fast and avid reader with a deep knowledge of contemporary commercial fiction
Base Salary Range: $62,400 - $70,000

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.

3140ae7e026ce44e,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3140ae7e026ce44e","http://www.indeed.com/job/agriculture-data-collection-technician-3140ae7e026ce44e","Agriculture Data Collection Technician","Waypoint Analytical","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","hourly",15.0,18.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","***This position is required to be on-site, when not located in the field.***

As the name implies, Waypoint Analytical is the company that you have been trying to find. Waypoint Analytical is a top environmental laboratory in the United States and is arguably the largest agricultural laboratory group. Headquartered in Memphis, TN and with a national footprint of full-service agriculture and environmental laboratories throughout the U.S., Waypoint Analytical (WA) has established its agricultural soil labs as the most reliable and timely provider of agricultural soil test data.

When you join the Waypoint Team you can feel the chemistry. There is a passion that can only be unlocked and shared in a diverse culture of collaborative teamwork, where science and service intersect to make us proud of what we provide.

Waypoint Analytical offers passionate people from all walks-of-life opportunities to be part of something special. You may have the goal of helping to feed the world, protect our environment, or offer scientifically sound solutions to complex problems.
**Waypoint Analytical is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nutrien, LTD.**

Field Service Technicians are responsible for collecting samples, completing field analysis, and ensuring samples are delivered from the client to the laboratory. for analysis. Their role is essential for ensuring accurate data and maintaining a safe work environment.
**What you will do:**
* Collect samples and conduct field analysis when required per procedures established by company.
* Record all information required for sample submittal or data upload to third party software systems.
* Ensure sample delivery from clients to the laboratory for analysis.
* Engage in physical labor (lifting, pulling, pushing) up to 50 lbs.
* Familiarity with personal protective equipment (PPE) requirements at various locations.
* Clean, maintain, troubleshoot, and program equipment. Various equipment including PH meters, sampling equipment, and mechanical equipment.
* Relay client requests to appropriate lab personnel.
* Able to drive for extended periods of time (4+ hours daily).
* Follow instructions, pay attention to details, and adapt to an ever-changing environment.
* May be required to transport, maintain, and safely operate ATV‘s or UTV’s.
* Model our core value of safety by enabling a culture in which you are actively contributing to a safe work environment.
* Other duties as required.
**What you will bring:**
* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Have and maintain a valid driver’s license.
* Have and maintain a mobile phone with the ability to receive calls and texts.
* Previous experience with sampling activities a bonus.
* Previous route driving experience preferred.

Waypoint Analytical is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Waypoint Analytical policies, you will be required to undergo a background check, and may be required to undergo a substance test. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
**To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on:** LinkedIn, Indeed, and Facebook.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $15.00 - $18.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Benefits:
* 401(k) matching
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
Schedule:
* 8 hour shift
Ability to Commute:
* New York, NY (Required)
Ability to Relocate:
* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

3f3f9f57a9416ee6,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3f3f9f57a9416ee6","http://www.indeed.com/job/school-monitor-pt-3f3f9f57a9416ee6","School Monitor P/T","Irvington Union Free School District","Irvington, NY, US","parttime","2024-08-19","","hourly","","","USD",False,"","","","","joyce.chapnick@irvingtonschools.org","**Recess Monitor**

Main Street School (4th/5th grade building) in Irvington is looking for Recess Monitors. The hours of the position are 11:50am – 1:50pm, Monday through Friday, when school is in session. The pay starts at $17.00 per hour. Recess Monitors provide supervision and assistance to students for recess activities during indoor and outdoor recess. When outside, Monitors supervise on the playground, blacktop and field, and when indoors, for board games, legos, drawing and videos. We are looking for individuals who have experience working with children.
Candidates should have the ability to:
* treat all students in a respectful, responsible and fair manner
* demonstrate appropriate responses to student-initiated interactions
* demonstrate fair and sound judgment when coping with conflict situation
* take direction and respond to instruction from supervisory staff

All Employees must be fingerprinted through NYS Education Department at their own expense (we provide the information regarding getting fingerprinted and the district will reimburse candidates after three weeks of employment). Applicants should email the principal at joyce.chapnick@irvingtonschools.org, please include a resume if possible.
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $18.00 per hour
Schedule:
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Irvington-Union-Free-School-District-1","","","","","","","","",""

Whether it be our health & wellness programs, best in class learning and development or our travel discounts that ‘feed your inner explorer’, we work hard to create and deliver on what YOU need. We are ready for you to start your journey with us where You Belong. We Care. Shine Bright.
We are looking for our next great team member to join us on our Culinary team. We are committed to providing you with:
* Highly competitive wages
* An exceptional benefit plan for eligible associates & your family members
* 401K matching program for eligible associates
* Flexible scheduling to allow you to focus on what is important to you
* Discounts with our Crescent managed properties in North America for you & your family members
* Tuition Assistance Benefit
**Here is what you will be doing each day:**
1. Take and serve guest orders promptly and according to service manual.
2. Do all necessary set-up side work as assigned.
3. Answer any guest questions about the menu.
4. Operate the electronic cash register/P.O.S. system (where applicable).
5. Check food before serving it to guest to ascertain that appearance, temperature and portions are correct.
6. Perform any other job related duties as assigned.
7. ***Certified in tips/food handling preferred***

*For applicants who will be working in NYC, the anticipated compensation range for the position is $16.00 - $18.00 dollars per hour. The salary offered to a successful candidate will be dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to years of experience within the job, years of experience within the required industry, education, work location, etc. Crescent Hotels is a multi-state employer and the salary ranges indicated herein may not reflect positions that work only in other states.*
#### **Experience**
Preferred* 1 year(s): Prior Hotel Experience desired
#### **Motivations**
Preferred* Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
* Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Crescent-Hotels-&-Resorts","https://www.crescenthotels.com","Fairfax, VA","10,000+","$100M to $500M (USD)","Discover how Crescent Hotels & Resorts can give you the career growth and success you are looking for!","https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_squarelogo/256x256/cf9d7136c078e58565eed7e82229dab5","https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_headerimage/1960x400/cad90ad5ea7600e1c1838a22caef85d2","Michael George","https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_ceophoto/512x512/15f492470d2459cc055de77163e5567e"

143f49ea5c9cea54,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=143f49ea5c9cea54","http://www.indeed.com/job/head-teacher-preschool-143f49ea5c9cea54","Head Teacher, Preschool","Brainiac Babies","Bronx, NY, US","parttime, fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",38000.0,42000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**Job Description:**

We are looking for an energetic, FUN, positive teacher to join our team!! Negative people, gossipers, and whiners need not to apply. If the following statement resonates with you, email your resume IMMEDIATELY!!!
* You must love to give hugs, wipe boogers, hold crying toddlers.
* You must be able to acknowledge and count a sea of moving heads instantaneously and locate anyone playing hide and seek by themselves (or with an imaginary friend).

* You must be able to love, laugh, and learn more about children than you ever have. This is by far one of the most joyous places to work, but you must be prepared to accept the challenges and benefits this job has to offer. Yes, you will have many days where you go home exhausted, but you can’t wait to go the next day and share that amazing Pinterest project you found with your staff.
**Teachers Position**
* AA or BA in Early Childhood Education or related field
* - 3 references
* - Fingerprinting & undergo background check
* - Previous teacher experience
**All team members must be a fit with our core values, which are:**
Fun, Integrity, family first, team work, growth
**This is going to be a great job because..**
Paid study time if needed
Opportunity for growth in the company
Discounted child care
Retirement Plan
Positive Company Culture
Professional Development
No day is the same
Bonuses
Strong leadership
Touch more lives
Make children and parents smile by providing fun, safe environment
**Here are 3 reasons teachers say they love working with us..**
* “Team Work is great”
* “It doesn’t feel like a job, feel like I’m taking care of my family”
* ""Parents are great""
**If you believe you can make a difference in this world and run a FUN successful school, then this job is for you!!!!!! Apply immediately this position will start in 2 weeks!!!**

Work Location: In person","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Brainiac-Babies","","","","","","","","",""

3e1327850045c6ed,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3e1327850045c6ed","http://www.indeed.com/job/field-marketing-specialist-east-3e1327850045c6ed","Field Marketing Specialist - East","Pollo Campero | Pollo Campero","Manhattan, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",75000.0,85000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","This position will oversee all the restaurants on the East market. This will require traveling to visit the different restaurants in charge.
Overview

The Field Marketing Specialist will execute marketing initiatives and tactical plans for a specific market according to national and regional marketing strategy. Her or she will be leading local community outreach via LSM, generating and fostering community relationships to increase brand awareness and build sales
Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communication or equivalent required
* 2+ years field marketing experience
* Experience in restaurant marketing preferred
* Background in retail promotional creation and execution required
* At least 80% time spent on field required
* Bilingua (English/Spanish) preferred

For 30 years, On Time has led the industry in medical transportation services and is the proud partner of Robert Wood Johnson Barnabas Health System. At On Time Mobility Assistance Vehicle Operators (MAVO) drive wheelchair vans, providing non-emergent medical transport to patients to and from different medical facilities.

Apply now if you are looking for a full-time opportunity as a MAVO driver and want to be a part of an awesome team. You will enjoy personal and professional growth, and a safe and supportive environment. On Time’s extensive training program is ideal for experienced and new drivers.
POSITION HIGHLIGHTS
· No experience needed as training is provided
· Various shifts and overtime available
· Health, dental, vision and life insurance
· 401(k) Retirement Plan
· Employee assistance program
· PTO (Paid Time Off)
· Tuition reimbursement
· Multiple advancement opportunities
ESSENTIAL DUTIES
· Drive in a safe and responsible manner, being familiar and adhering to laws and company driving policies/standards at all times.
· Assist wheelchair and non-wheelchair bound passengers to enter and depart vehicle and into and out of pickup/drop-off points.
(Stairs may be involved.)
· Project a professional image and attitude when interacting with patients/clients, the public and other employees.
· Provide ancillary assistance to passengers (ie. holding umbrellas in wet weather, loading and unload baggage and luggage.)
· Wear a seat belt at all times when riding in company vehicles and require passengers to do the same and assist passengers with
seat belt and ensuring they remain seat belted during transport.
· Ensure that wheelchairs and child restraints are appropriately secured to the vehicle.
· Perform CPR, as necessary.
· Be familiar with safe lifting and moving techniques and be physically/mentally fit for the performance of job duties.
· Be familiar with the proper use of all vehicle safety equipment (ie. child seats).
· Be responsible for assigned equipment. Must inspect all equipment and report any malfunctions.
· Be familiar with all company forms related to field associates and their purposes. Fill them out properly, and obtain corresponding
signatures.
· Adhere to field associate dress code and personal appearance policies.
· Have a working knowledge of the company communications systems and communications policies and procedures.
· Report all field incidents and non-routine situations that have arisen to dispatchers, supervisors, or managers on a daily basis.
· Be familiar with and comply with rules at major receiving client/facility locations.
· Assume responsibility for cleanliness of vehicle on a daily basis. Perform pre-trip and post-trip inspection.
· Be familiar with navigation equipment and capable of navigating in all response areas of the company.
· Inspect and report any vehicle damage or malfunction and check all fluid levels and ensure they are replenished, if necessary.
Must refuel vehicle. Be familiar with fleet card usage.
· Remain in close contact with dispatch, updating them on vehicle location and client information.
· Maintain order on the vehicle.
· Ensure that minors are left with approved guardians.
· Perform other related duties as required.

* Candidates who are offered a position will be subject to drug screening and employment.

* Must meet Logisticare approval as a condition of employment.

fe54ee256e830001,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=fe54ee256e830001","https://us241.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/spear/Posting/View/10737?source=Indeed","Physical Therapy Aide Hoboken","SPEAR Physical Therapy","Hoboken, NJ, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","","hourly","","","USD",False,"","","","","","Physical Therapy Technician –Hoboken, NJ
Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is seeking a qualified, passionate Physical Therapy Technician to join the team at our Hoboken clinic in NJ.

Therapy Technicians are responsible for supporting patient care by preparing treatment areas, gathering equipment and materials, and performing procedures under the direct supervision of a Physical or Occupational Therapist. Therapy Technicians are expected to execute a high standard of clinical excellence while maintaining 5-star customer service. Spear strives to foster a true community environment for both patients and team members; therefore, a collaborative spirit is valued to ensure everyone receives the care and support they need.
**QUALIFICATIONS:**
* Previous customer service experience.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi-task.
* A strong attention to detail and willingness to grow.
* Athletic experience a plus!
**WHAT WE OFFER:**
We know that exceptional patient service can only be achieved when our team is well cared for.
We strive to create an environment that bolsters career growth while providing the flexibility and
time necessary to simply be a human being. Further benefits include:
* Mentorship Programs and Spear's award-winning Future Leaders Program (SFLP).
* One Medical paid membership. Learn more at onemedical.com/business.
* Mental Health benefits that include paid time off and support services through Journey Live & employer sponsored EAP program.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, Commuter FSA Plan.

* 401(K) Safe Harbor Match: SPEAR will make a matching contribution equal to 100% of the first 3% of annual compensation, plus 50% of the next 2% of annual compensation. The total SPEAR matching contribution will not exceed 4% of your annual compensation
* Generous paid time including PTO, Floating Holidays, Company Holidays, Mental Health
* Commuter FSA Plans – pretax savings plans for travel to & from work
* Employee Perks: discounted rates for entertainment, travel, fitness, insurance plans, etc. Gym membership discounts with Blink & Crunch Fitness.
* Company Events - Annual Summer Picnic and Holiday Awards Celebration
**SALARY:** $15.25 / hr
**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**

We value empathy in our team members and a dedication to clinical excellence -- whatever your workstyle -- above all else. While we are looking for both entrepreneurial big-thinkers and those dedicated simply to the day-to-day of treatment, successful candidates will understand that being clear is kind and that actions express priorities. No matter where you are in your career, we are positive you will find your niche with us and grow.
**Further success factors may include:**
* A passion for the field of physical and occupational therapy.
* A proactive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude because we don’t work in silos.
* A dedication to not only rehabilitating patients’ injuries but their confidence and vitality as well.
* A sense of accomplishment from pairing your clinical excellence with emotional intelligence.
* You celebrate wins and learn from losses with your patients, colleagues, and surrounding communities.
* A resonance with our SPEAR-IT values:
* Service
* Passion
* Empathy
* Accountability
* Respect
* Impact
* Teamwork
**ABOUT US:**

Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is the nation’s leading outpatient practice. With more than 40 clinics in the New York Tri-State Area and 25 years of experience, Spear provides unprecedented patient access to physical and occupational therapy through its robust list of services covered by most major insurances. Since its founding, Spear has been honored by some of the top medical, academic, and business communities. Among these accolades, they have twice been named the nation’s top physical therapy practice by the American Physical Therapy Association and WebPT, received the Columbia Award for Leadership in Clinical Education, served as official therapists to Olympic teams and Broadway shows, and been featured for their expertise in The New York Times, CBS News, Good Morning America, The Today Show, and more. The ophthalmic assistant conduct measurements and tests that provides the physician with the information needed to arrive at a diagnosis and to prescribe treatment. The ophthalmic assistant is responsible for required documentation in compliance with the policies and provide excellent patient services.
**Roles and Responsibilities**
* Takes an ocular and systemic history and accurately records visual acuity.
* Reviews patient chart to ensure completeness and accuracy of information.
* Performs testing required by type of exam scheduled, patient complaint and history.
* Acts as scribe while physician examines patient entering data into electronic medical records.

* Performs lensometry, automated refractometry, slit lamp examination including applanation tonometry, anterior chamber angle assessment and gross external exam in addition to ocular muscle motility and balance testing, assess pupils and confrontation visual fields.
* Administers diagnostic tests including but not limited to oct, automated visual fields, photography, pachymetry, biometry.
* Administers topical ophthalmic or oral medications.
* Assists with in-office procedures ensuring proper informed consent is obtained, sets up and cleans up after clinical procedures.
* Assists with patient education.
* Maintains cleanliness and orderliness of exam rooms during the workday.

* Complies with all practice procedures and protocols. Complies with all state and federal regulations. Understands and accepts responsibility to report potential or suspected errors to supervisor or compliance officer.
* Maintains positive attitude consisting of cooperation, self-motivation, courtesy, and professionalism.
**Knowledge, skills, abilities**
* Accountability – ability to accept responsibility and account for his/her actions or work performed. Willing to accept constructive criticism.
* Accuracy – ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly with attention to all details of a project or task.
* Adaptability – ability to adapt to and facilitate change in the workplace.
* Communication – ability to communicate effectively with others using good listening skills.

* Empathetic – ability to appreciate and be sensitive to the feelings of patients and co-workers. Exhibits a cheerful demeanor with the ability to display good-natured tolerance of delay or adversity.
* Initiative – ability to make decisions or take actions to solve a problem or reach a goal. Desire to excel, attempting non-routine tasks.
* Judgment – the ability to formulate a sound decision using the available information.
* Reliability – can be relied upon to demonstrate reliability in attendance and punctuality.

* Team player – the ability to work with others and independently for a common goal. Puts aside own individual needs to work toward the larger group objective and reinforces the contribution of others.
**Qualifications:**
High School diploma or equivalent required.
Previous experience in eye care preferred but not required.
Basic computer skills for electronic recordkeeping.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
**Physical Requirements & ADA Compliance:**
Ability to stand or sit for prolonged periods.
Visual acuity to perform job-related tasks.
Manual dexterity to operate specialized equipment.
**ADA Requirements:**

This job is compliant with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and we encourage people with disabilities to apply. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.","https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Prism-Vision-Group","http://www.prismvisiongroup.com","Headquarters

a1cb2e9f16ac264c,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a1cb2e9f16ac264c","http://www.indeed.com/job/oakberry-herald-square-team-member-a1cb2e9f16ac264c","Oakberry Herald Square | Team Member","Oakberry UES LLC","New York, NY, US","parttime","2024-08-19","","hourly","","","USD",False,"","","","","","**ABOUT THE COMPANY**

OAKBERRY was created to satisfy an unmet demand in the food market: healthy fast-food. Not everyone has time to eat in a way that’s both healthy and energetic. Our mission is to deliver a tasty, natural, and nutritious experience, fast. We want to change the way fast-food is perceived. Time and good health are important factors for our quality of life. This is the reason for our existence.

OAKBERRY’s Açaí is 100% natural. Our recipe contains no food coloring, artificial preservatives, or guarana syrup. OAKBERRY’s production process seeks to preserve as much as possible all the benefits of the açaí fruit.
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Join the OAKBERRY team and become a vital part of our renowned açaí company dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experiences. We are seeking a dynamic Team Member to contribute to our mission of promoting a healthy lifestyle through our delicious smoothies and açaí bowls. **This role will report directly to the Store Lead.**
**RESPONSIBILITIES - 10 Steps for a Daily Routine as a Team Member**
* **Be punctual:** Arrive on time for your shifts, ready to dive in and deliver your best. Responsible for maintaining accurate timekeeping records before each payroll cycle.
* **Set up the store:** Operate the electric, music, lighting, umbrella, chair, and other set-up to ensure the store aligns with OAKBERRY guidelines, providing a great customer experience.
* **Master the menu:** Know our products inside and out to impress customers with your knowledge; if you have questions, ask your supervisor.
* **Exceptional Customer Experience:** Greet customers warmly, creating a friendly environment and ensuring swift service that makes each customer feel valued.

* **OAKBERRY products:** Focus on preparing and selling smoothies, bowls, bars, shots, beverages, snacks, etc. Level up: Suggest add-ons and specials to boost sales and encourage repeat customers. Ensure the highest quality and presentation for food and beverage items.
* **Own your space:** Keep it clean and organized to create a welcoming environment that customers love, and ensure proper food and equipment handling.
* **Operate the register:** Handle the card and/or cash register with care and integrity, ensuring every penny is accounted for.
* Sanitize regularly: Clean and sanitize equipment, work surfaces, and utensils to maintain a safe and hygienic environment.
* **Rock the look:** Wear your OAKBERRY uniform with pride and represent our brand stylishly.
* **Store Maintenance:** Manage inventory levels and restock supplies as needed to maintain smooth operations. Receive and inspect orders from vendors to ensure accuracy and quality.
**QUALIFICATIONS**
* Authorized to work in the US.
* Flexible to work weekends, holidays, and adhere to a fixed schedule for consistent attendance.
* Preferably has previous customer service or food service experience.
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment, excels at multitasking, and comfortable working independently.
* Commits to consistent attendance based on Oakberry's fixed schedule.
* Team-oriented with excellent communication abilities.
* Passionate about promoting a healthy lifestyle and Oakberry products.
* Willingness to learn and stay updated on products, policies, and standards.
* Maintains high standards for food and beverage quality and presentation.
* Capable of working standing for extended periods and lifting weights as required.
* Holds or willing to obtain a Food Handler Certificate.
* Able to use a cellphone for scheduling apps like Square Team and 7Shifts for emails and text messages as needed.
**EMPLOYMENT DETAILS**
**Job Type**: Part-Time or Full-Time position
**Salary:** $16.00/hour + Supplemental Pay (Tips)
**BENEFITS**
**Employee Discount:** Enjoy a generous discount on OAKBERRY products at your location.
**Positive Work Environment:** Be part of a positive and inclusive team where every member is valued.
**Fixed Schedule:** Ensure a work-life balance with a predictable fixed schedule.
**Free Uniforms:** Receive your OAKBERRY uniform at no cost and wear it with pride.
**Paid Training:** Get paid while you learn and grow with us.
**Events:** Get the chance to participate in exclusive List-A events sponsored by OAKBERRY.
**Paid Sick Leave:** Take care of your health with our paid sick leave benefit.
**OVERTIME**

All authorized and approved work performed in excess of forty (40) hours in any one week shall be considered as overtime and shall be paid at the overtime rate of one and one-half times the employee's straight time rate of pay. All overtime must be approved and authorized prior to being worked.

With over 500 full-time employees serving children and families in multiple programs throughout the Bronx, Brooklyn and Harlem, Graham Windham provides an exciting and enriching work experience.

Currently licensed as a Registered Nurse by the New York State Education Department. Minimum 1 year experience working with individuals with mental health diagnoses.A valid and clean NY State driver license. Fingerprinting, criminal record check, approval from NYS Office of Mental Health.
**JOB FUNCTION:**

Provide medical services on a community based mobile, multi-disciplinary treatment team for young adults (ages 18-28) diagnosed with severe persistent mental illness. Provide management and administration of medications, in conjunction with the Psychiatrist or NPP. Ensure medical standards as per program regulations are being provided
**BENEFITS INCLUDE:**
* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* Retirement 401K Savings Plan with Employer Match

* Eligibility for Federal/Public Loan Forgiveness
**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:**

RiseWell provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
**About Us:**

RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is a multi-service, community-based social wellness agency and is a major provider of health and wellness, senior & children’s services, housing, and support services in Suffolk, Nassau, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan. Originally comprised of an alliance of family advocacy groups, RiseWell Community Services was incorporated as a not-for-profit in 1972. For fifty years, RiseWell has developed innovative, successful programs that are designed to meet the needs of vulnerable populations, such as individuals in recovery, those living with chronic medical conditions, adult home residents, the homeless, low-income seniors and at-risk children. Since 1977, RiseWell’s mission has been to engage people with disabilities in community service and provide a wide range of programs including care coordination, housing, clinical treatment, employment, peer advocacy, and other rehabilitative services. One of RiseWell’s main goals is to improve the lives of people with disabilities and their families through education, information and referral services, legislative action and program development.

df8776b16c0ef4c7,"indeed","https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=df8776b16c0ef4c7","http://www.indeed.com/job/ellenl-teacher-df8776b16c0ef4c7","ELL/ENL Teacher","Innovation Charter High School","New York, NY, US","fulltime","2024-08-19","direct_data","yearly",60000.0,85000.0,"USD",False,"","","","","","**ELL/ENL Teacher**
Job Description
**OUR MISSION**

Innovation nurtures and develops students to be academically successful, socially mature, emotionally healthy, and equipped to lead self-directed and fulfilling lives. We welcome all students and we empower them to adapt, excel, innovate and lead. By instilling the core values of collaboration, tolerance, respect, activism, safety and innovation, students will graduate prepared for success in college and careers.
**Summary:**

In furtherance of Innovation’s mission, ELL/ENL Teachers at Innovation ensure that our student-innovators will achieve rigorous academic goals by setting self-created, individualized educational goals within a three-tiered educational model of core classroom instruction, portfolio-based annual individual projects, and hands-on, experiential learning. Specifically, ELL/ENL Teachers either lead or co-plan, co-instruct, and co-assess students in the mainstream classroom. Under the direction of the Languages Department Chair, ELL/ENL teachers collaborate with general education teachers to develop, organize and implement an appropriate instructional program in an inclusive learning environment that guides and encourages **ALL** students to develop and fulfill their academic potential.
**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Serve as the ENL case-manager for an assigned group of students and document monthly contact.
* Implement ENL interventions, support services, and strategies into an integrated classroom and coach the general education teachers of the remaining content areas on said goals and strategies.

* Lead classroom differentiation for ENL students through curricular modifications, instructional techniques, parallel instruction, small group pull-outs and integrated classroom strategies that meet individuals’ needs.
* Communication with teachers (frequently), in order to assess student progress toward meeting ILP Measurable Annual Goals
* Coordinate/collaborate with IEP service providers/other teachers where appropriate to ensure effective wraparound services and supports for ELL students
* Administer pre-assessments and NYSESLAT Assessment
* Assess and develop goals for the Individual Learning Plan for all ELL students and monitor progress of students on the assigned caseload.
* Collect and analyze academic performance data from all academic courses
* Review student achievement and performance data daily and amend your instructional approach accordingly
* Interpret MAP student performance testing data and align with differentiated and individualized classroom instruction.
* Regularly and accurately report student progress and maintain accurate and up-to-date records related to student achievement, performance, and ELL/ENL goals in case management system.
* Create ENL teacher report and email to Department Chair by the designated submission date
* Communicate frequently with students, students’ families, colleagues, and other school management team.
* Prepare for, attend, and participate in Parent Teacher Conferences and Child Study Teams as a student and family advocate.
* Attend Parent Teacher Conferences and take an active role in school-community outreach
* Regularly attend ENL Department meetings in addition to the content area department meetings
* Strong understanding and ability to implement Innovation's mission and vision.
* Take an active role in your professional development by identifying and creating opportunities to expand your skills to meet the demands of individual student needs.
* Complete a minimum of 40 hours of professional development per year.
* Full-time instruction/supervision during Enrichment Week planning, pre-course classes and courses during Enrichment Week

* Commit to and provide a minimum of two hours of weekly supplemental instruction (tutorials or open office hours for the purpose of providing academic support services) provide supervision of an co-curricular team, class, club, or program
* Teach classes and perform the associated duties of a classroom instructor for the assigned department including:
* Create and implement lesson plans based on Innovation’s 3-tier model of core curriculum, hands-on, experiential learning, and project-based learning
* Work closely with peers and administration to develop multifaceted curriculum that integrates multiple subjects and approaches and provides opportunities to develop student leadership
* Take an entrepreneurial approach to your curriculum, teaching methods, and optional duties
* Maintain an awareness of school’s strategic initiatives and incorporate them into your work, including working with partner organizations
* Communicate frequently with students and students’ families via phone, email, home visits or face to face meetings
* Additional duties as assigned by the Principal or his/her designee.
**Minimum Qualifications:**
* New York State Teaching Certification in ESL 7-12 **is required.**
* Dual certification in a Foreign Language 7-12 **is preferred.**
* Three to five years of classroom experience **is preferred**.
**Supervisor:**
The Principal and/or their designee.
**Evaluation**

Teacher performance is formally appraised during evaluation cycles that occur at least two times during the school year. Appraisals are transparent, collaborative, intended to promote professional growth, and based on accomplishment of the major goals and responsibilities outlined in your job description.
**Salary & Benefits**

This is a full-time position. The salary range is $60,000 - $85,000 per year. Salary is highly competitive and is commensurate with experience and qualifications. Innovation offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, and a 401k retirement plan with an employer matching contribution up to 5%.
***Please apply online:*** ***http://www.innovationhighschool.org/work-at-innovation***

Our intense training produces a professional staff worthy of securing only the best. Our clients have included major people of prestige in the fields of politics, athletics, and entertainment. Over the past decade, we have transferred our expertise in Executive Protection to fit the needs of developers, management companies and promoters with customized security service plans for residential and corporate properties, commercial facilities, as well as Music Award Shows and concerts.
**Responsibilities**:
As a Site Manager, you will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:
- Implementing disciplinary actions when necessary.
- Overseeing site safety and ensuring adherence to safety protocols.
- Documenting incidents accurately and promptly.
- Conducting inspections of security officers to ensure compliance and professionalism.
- Providing emergency relief and managing crisis situations effectively.
- Orienting and training all guards on site.
- Evaluating employees' performance and providing constructive feedback.
- Assigning security posts and managing guard schedules.
- Utilizing and managing guard management software effectively.
- Resolving conflicts among team members and stakeholders.
- Creating and maintaining accurate schedules for optimal coverage.
**Duties:**

Ensure accurate documentation of site logbook entries, vertical tour reports, visitors' log, maintenance log, and incident reports, and submit all necessary documents to the NFS Executive Team and Client Contact.
Prepare monthly and periodic reports on site activities for Client Contact and NFS Executive Team.
Conduct regular inspections of security personnel to ensure they embody the professional image of NFS, are well-groomed, and in proper uniform during their shifts.
Educate and enforce NFS regulations and site policies and procedures, providing training to all employees on-site.
Enforce disciplinary action notices for employees who violate company rules and procedures, reporting them to the Chief of Operations and Human Resources.
Make recommendations for employee promotions, suspensions, and terminations based on work history and performance.
Review and address issues regarding the utilization and maintenance of security equipment, notifying the appropriate personnel.
Perform unannounced site inspections to ensure guards' compliance with company rules and procedures.
